snippet: Democrats say the effort by Republicans to undermine attempts for a nuclear agreement with Iran is weakening their resolve to cross party lines and challenge their own president.
abstract: Democrats criticize open letter sent by 47 Republicans to Iran's leaders warning about nuclear agreement with Pres Obama, saying it undermines his attempts but also lessens their resolve to cross party lines and challenge him; GOP remains defiant about letter, as recriminations from Democrats threaten to undo bipartisan coalition to oppose deal.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS
byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: Democrats say the effort by Republicans to undermine attempts for a nuclear agreement with Iran is weakening their resolve to cross party lines and challenge their own president.

headline.main: Irate Democrats Denounce G.O.P on Iran Letter
headline.print_headline: Irate Democrats Denounce G.O.P. on Iran Letter
